results.title: News
results.creator_credit: Tim King, Mike Wooller and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows how the news is gathered and presented on the 9 o’clock news on BBC1, including the build-up of tension among the team when making time and location checks. Great “bird’s-eye” view of the news team.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tim King, Mike Wooller and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: 1945: the year that shaped our world
results.creator_credit: Therese Denny and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Documentary focusing on Europe and Britain after the end of World War II, showing the social and political changes that were in the air. The events of that years are reconstructed from film shot at the time.
results.title_for_label: 1945: the year that shaped our world
results.description: Documentary focusing on Europe and Britain after the end of World War II, showing the social and political changes that were in the air. The events of that years are reconstructed from film shot at the time.

results.title: Yellow trail from Texas
results.brief_description: Despite the hard work and nomadic life style of wheat harvest crews as they travel from Texas to Canada. Considers the implications of the harvest on the ecomony and nutritional health of the world.
results.description: Despite the hard work and nomadic life style of wheat harvest crews as they travel from Texas to Canada. Considers the implications of the harvest on the ecomony and nutritional health of the world.

results.title: The River that came clean
results.creator_credit: Christopher Riley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
An environmental success story that begins by emphasising the role of sewage as a major pollutant of the River Thames since the mid 19th century. Shows evidence of the great increase in fish and bird life after a cleaning process was instigated. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description:

results.title: The Red planet
results.creator_credit: Tony Edwards and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Traces three hundred years of speculation, investigation and discovery that have centred on the planet Mars. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Children of Peru
results.creator_credit: Michael Andrews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Documents new agricultural methods and technological discoveries in Peru and the beneficial effects these might have on the health and nutrition of the children of Peru if implemented. Narrated by paul Vaughan. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Documents new agricultural methods and technological discoveries in Peru and the beneficial effects these might have on the health and nutrition of the children of Peru if implemented. Narrated by paul Vaughan. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Documents new agricultural methods and technological discoveries in Peru and the beneficial effects these might have on the health and nutrition of the children of Peru if implemented. Narrated by paul Vaughan. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Ghana: ways forward
results.brief_description: Considers that progress in the form pf automation may have come too early for a country like Ghana. Now many of the population are idle. Looks at government instigated self-help programmes, which utilise the country’s biggest resource - people and aid in productivity.
results.description: Considers that progress in the form pf automation may have come too early for a country like Ghana. Now many of the population are idle. Looks at government instigated self-help programmes, which utilise the country’s biggest resource - people and aid in productivity.

results.title: Land divers of Melanesia
results.creator_credit: Karl Muller, Robert Gardner and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Documents the salient features of the intact culture of Melanesia, including agriculture, play and ritual of Bunlap on Pentecost Island in the New Hebrides. Shows the relationship between yam agriculture and ceremonies such as land diving.

results.title: In the beginning
results.brief_description: A colourful clay animation film which satirizes society and its impulse to invent nuclear weapons which cause self-destruction. Looks at the invention of destructive weapons from raspberries to rockets! Narration: Brian Woods. Animation: Mark D’Arcy-Irvine, Masfufah Sani. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: A Zoo's eye view: dawn to dark
results.creator_credit: James A. Oliver, Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Depicts the drama of a typical day at the San Diego Zoo. Shows the morning visitors, lively animals, an afternoon thunderstorm, and the quiet that returns as night draws near. Suitable for primary grades.
